The texture of iron ingots has been changed.
Iron ingots can be smelted from iron ore and drop 3–5 iron ingots.
Iron ingots can be used to craft iron blocks, flint and steel and iron swords, shovels, pickaxes and axes.
Iron ingots are now used to craft arrows.
Iron ingots can now be used to craft iron hoes.
Smelting now drops only 1 iron ingot (down from 3–5).
Iron blocks now require 9 iron ingots (3x3) instead 4 (2x2) to be crafted, making them much more expensive.
Iron ingots are now used to craft iron helmets, chestplates, leggings and boots.
Iron ingots are now used to craft buckets.
Iron ingots are now used to craft rails and minecarts.
Iron ingots can be found in dungeon chests.
Iron ingots are now used to craft iron doors.
Iron ingots are no longer used to craft arrows.
Iron ingots are now used to craft compasses.
Iron ingots are now used to craft detector rails.
Iron ingots are now used to craft pistons and shears.
Iron ingots are found in the new stronghold storeroom and mineshaft chests.
Iron ingots are now used to craft iron bars.
Iron ingots are now used to craft cauldrons.
Iron ingots are now found in the new stronghold altar chests.
Iron ingots are now found in village blacksmith chests.
Zombies now rarely drop iron ingots, making it a renewable resource.
Iron golems now drop 3–5 iron ingots.
Added desert temples, with a hidden chest room and loot containing iron ingots.
Blacksmith villagers now buy 8–9 iron ingots for 1 emerald.
Added jungle temples, which contain loot chests with iron ingots.
Iron ingots are now used to craft tripwire hooks.
Iron ingots can be used to activate beacons.

Iron ingots are now used to craft heavy weighted pressure plates.

Iron ingots are now found in nether fortress chests.
Trading for iron ingots has been changed: armorer, weapon smith and tool smith villagers now buy 7–9 iron ingots for 1 emerald.
Iron ingots are now used to craft iron trapdoors.
Iron ingots are now found in end city ship chests.
Iron ingots are now used to craft shields.
The average yield from dungeon and desert temple chests has been substantially decreased.
The average yield from mineshaft and nether fortress chests has been slightly decreased.
Iron ingots are now found in the new woodland mansion chests.
Iron ingots are now used to craft iron nuggets.
Prior to The Flattening, this item's numeral ID was 265.
Iron ingots now generate in buried treasure chests.
Iron ingots can now be found in the chests of shipwrecks.
Iron ingots can now be used to craft crossbows.
The texture of iron ingots has been changed.
Iron ingots can now be found inside of loot chests on top of pillager outposts.
Iron ingots can now be found in chests in village toolsmith houses.
Iron ingots can now be used to craft a blast furnace.
Iron ingots can now be used to craft stonecutters.
Iron ingots can now be used to heal iron golems.
Iron ingots now generate in bastion remnants chests.
Iron ingots are now used to craft chains.
The average yield of iron ingots from bastion remnant chests has been slightly increased.
Iron ingots can now be smelted from deepslate iron ore.
Added iron ingots. They are currently unobtainable and serve no purpose.
Iron ingots are now obtainable by smelting iron ore in a furnace.
Iron ingots can be used to craft shears, blocks of iron and iron pickaxes, axes, swords and shovels.
Iron ingots are now used to craft flint and steel and iron hoes.
Iron ingots are now used to craft nether reactor cores.
Iron ingots are now used to craft iron armor.
Iron ingots are now used to craft buckets.
Iron ingots are now used to craft compasses, minecarts, iron bars and rails.
Iron ingots can now be found in village blacksmith chests, stronghold altar chests and dungeon chests.
Zombies now rarely drop iron ingots.
Iron ingots are no longer used to craft nether reactor cores and are instead dropped by it.
Iron ingots are now used to craft anvils.
Iron ingots are now found in nether fortress chests.
Added iron golems, which drop iron ingots.
Iron ingots can now be used to repair iron tools, armor and weapons in anvils.
Added zombie villagers, which rarely drop iron ingots.
Iron ingots are now used to craft tripwire hooks, detector rails, iron trapdoors and heavy weighted pressure plates.
Added desert temples, which have hidden chest rooms and loot containing iron ingots.
Iron ingots are now used to craft hoppers and cauldrons.
Iron ingots can now be found in minecart chests generated in mineshafts.
Iron ingots are now used to craft pistons.
Added jungle temples, which have hidden chest rooms and main treasure rooms that have loot containing iron ingots.
Added husks, which rarely drop iron ingots.
Iron ingots can now be used to activate beacons.
Iron ingots can now be found in end city ship chests.
Iron ingots can now be found in stronghold storeroom chests.
Added trading—armorer, weaponsmith and toolsmith villagers now buy 7–9 iron ingots for 1 emerald.
Iron ingots can now be crafted using iron nuggets.
Iron ingots can now be used to craft iron nuggets.
Iron ingots can now be found in woodland mansion chests.
Iron ingots now generate in buried treasure chests.
Iron ingots can now be found in shipwreck treasure chests.
Iron ingots can now be used to craft crossbows.
Iron ingots can now be found inside pillager outposts and plains villages' weaponsmith chests.
Iron ingots can now be used to craft blast furnaces, stonecutters and shields.
The texture of iron ingots has been changed.
Iron ingots can now be found in village armorer and toolsmith chests.
Iron ingots can now be found in savanna, taiga, desert and snowy taiga village weaponsmiths.
Armorer, toolsmith, and weaponsmith villagers now buy 4 iron ingots for an emerald.
Iron ingots now generate in bastion remnants chests.
Iron ingots can now be used to heal iron golems.

texts.text: This article is about the ingot. For the ore, see Iron Ore. For the mineral block, see Block of Iron. For the nugget, see Iron Nugget.
Iron ingots are versatile metal ingots used extensively in crafting.

1 Obtaining
1.1 Chest loot
1.2 Crafting
1.3 Smelting
1.4 Compound creation
1.5 Mob Loot
2 Usage
2.1 Crafting ingredient
2.2 Trading
2.3 Repairing
2.4 Healing iron golems
2.5 Beacons
3 Achievements
4 Advancements
5 Data values
5.1 ID
6 History
7 Issues
8 Trivia
9 See also
10 External links
See also: Iron Ore § Natural generation
Smelting raw iron in a furnace or blast furnace is the most common way to obtain iron ingots.
Iron Ingot can be created from its base elements, using the compound creator.‌[Bedrock and Education editions only]
Iron golems drop 3-5 iron ingots upon death, regardless of the way they die. The looting enchantment does not increase the amount of iron ingots dropped.

Zombies, husks, and zombie villagers have a 2.5% chance of dropping either an iron ingot, carrot, or potato when killed by a player or tamed wolf. This is increased by 1% per level of looting. This gives iron ingots the following chances of dropping:

1⁄120 (about 0.83%)
11⁄600 (about 1.83%) with Looting I
17⁄600 (about 2.83%) with Looting II
23⁄600 (about 3.83%) with Looting III
Apprentice-level Armorer, Toolsmith, and Weaponsmith villagers buy 4 iron ingots for an emerald as their third trade.‌[Bedrock Edition only]

Apprentice-level Armorer villagers have a 50% chance to buy 4 iron ingots for one emerald, and apprentice-level Toolsmith and Weaponsmith villagers always offer to buy 4 iron ingots for one emerald.‌[Java Edition only]
Iron ingots are the repair items for the iron tier and chainmail and iron armor materials, and thus can be used to repair the following items in an anvil:

Chainmail Helmet
Chainmail Chestplate
Chainmail Leggings
Chainmail Boots
Iron Helmet
Iron Chestplate
Iron Leggings
Iron Boots
Iron Sword
Iron Axe
Iron Pickaxe
Iron Shovel
Iron Hoe
Using an iron ingot on an iron golem restores its health by 25 × 12.5.
Iron ingots can be used to select powers from a beacon. The player must select one of the available powers, and then insert an iron ingot in the item slot.
An iron ingot can be substituted for an emerald, a gold ingot, a diamond, or a netherite ingot.
Issues relating to "Iron Ingot" are maintained on the bug tracker. Report issues there.

The iron ingot is used in 34 crafting recipes, more than any other item in the game. Planks take the second place with 33 recipes.
To craft each recipe once, a player would need 153 iron ingots, including 27 for the iron blocks in an anvil, and one for the tripwire hook in a crossbow.
